trans-unit.source: Provides properties and methods for constructing an e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Mail.MailMessage"></xref> class.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
Specifies the collection of attachments that are transmitted with the message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
New attachments can be added to the mail message by a call to `Message.Attachments.Add(MyMailMessage)`.
See <xref:System.Web.Mail.SmtpMail.Send%2A> for an example of <xref:System.Web.Mail.SmtpMail> usage.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.Mail.MailAttachment"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of email addresses that receive a blind carbon copy (BCC) of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
Recipients in the semicolon-delimited list can be either email addresses or address book display names.
The primary and carbon copy (<xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage.Cc%2A>) recipients do not see the addresses in the `Bcc` field.
A semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses that receive a blind carbon copy (BCC) of the e-mail message.
Gets or sets the body of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The body of the e-mail message.
Gets or sets the encoding type of the body of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> values that indicates the encoding type of the body of the e-mail message.
Gets or sets the content type of the body of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Mail.MailFormat"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses that receive a carbon copy (CC) of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
Recipients in the semicolon-delimited list can be either email addresses or address book display names.
A semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses that receive a carbon copy (CC) of the e-mail message.
Gets a collection of objects that map to Microsoft Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) fields.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage.Fields%2A> property is used to set extended properties for Collaboration Data Objects (CDO).
For more information about CDO, see "Collaboration Data Objects" and "Configuration CoClass" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> collection of objects that map to Collaboration Data Objects (CDO) fields.
Gets or sets the e-mail address of the sender.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The sender's e-mail address.
Specifies the custom headers that are transmitted with the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> collection of custom headers.
Gets or sets the priority of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Mail.MailPriority"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the subject line of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The subject line of the e-mail message.
Gets or sets a semicolon-delimited list of recipient e-mail addresses.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
Recipients in the semicolon-delimited list can be either email addresses or address book display names.
A semicolon-delimited list of e-mail addresses.
Gets or sets the `Content-Base` HTTP header, the URL base of all relative URLs used within the HTML-encoded body of the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The URL base.
Gets or sets the `Content-Location` HTTP header for the e-mail message.
Recommended alternative: <xref href="System.Net.Mail"></xref>.
The `content-base` header.
